{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3547744,"name":"Mike DeFiore","username":"defiorem742","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/defiorem742/{size}/231564_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T00:07:35.541Z","cooked":"

We are trying to control the robot using an Xbox controller wirelessly, but the input is delayed by a several hundred milliseconds which is making it very difficult to test/make precise movement adjustments. We had this problem the other day but solved it by updating the firmware on all of the motor controllers and CANCoders. However, it now has a delay again, and we’re not sure why after researching thoroughly. any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T00:07:35.541Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":92.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494268,"topic_slug":"input-delay-on-xbox-controller-to-robot","display_username":"Mike DeFiore","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67537,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Coder/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/input-delay-on-xbox-controller-to-robot/494268/1","custom_user_title":"Lead Coder/Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3548066,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T08:29:46.422Z","cooked":"

How are you measuring the delay? The key to identifying the source is to narrow the sesrch domain. Right now it could be anything from the controller itself, to windows (controller driver, low system resources, security software interfering with network traffic, etc), to network issues (bandwidth limits, bad cable, etc), to robot code issues, and much more.

defiorem742:

Xbox controller wirelessly

This is illegal for competition. You need to be using the controller in wired mode.

Sorry, I misspoke, I meant that we were using an Xbox controller wired to to a laptop which was using radio to communicate with the robot.

Update: We had SmartDashboard statements in the periodic of one of our subsystems which was seemingly causing the delay (the robotPeriodic() for that subsystem was about 200x longer than the others according to the RioLog).

Putting something to smartdashboard is fast. Getting that something in order to put it to smartdashboard may be slow. Just want to make sure you’re looking in the right place for the slowdown.
